introduction.para: This document details the procedure for replacing the front and rear lights on a bicycle, specifically involving the replacement of yellow bulbs with white bulbs and modification of the glass cover.

safety_precautions.para: Refer to warning and caution references: c001, c002, w001 for detailed safety information.

tool.name: Toolset
tool.description: Special toolset containing a screwdriver (reference: seq-0001).

tool.name: Screwdriver
tool.description: Special screwdriver (reference: seq-0002) from the toolset.

material.name: Original Glass
material.description: Original glass (reference: spa-0008) can be modified.

step.title: Front Light Replacement
step.instruction: From location wla-0001, remove the glass cover (spa-0005).
Remove the used yellow front bulb (spa-0001).
Remove the new white bulb (spa-0003) from the kit (spa-0002).
Install the glass cover (spa-0005) on the light.
Attach the light fitting to the handlebar.
Apply the protective strip around the handlebar.
Install the washer on the screw.
Use the special screwdriver (seq-0002) from the toolset (seq-0001) and tighten the screw into the hole at the bottom of the clamp to secure it to the handlebar.

step.title: Rear Light Replacement
step.instruction: From location wla-0002, remove the glass cover (spa-0005).
Remove the used yellow rear bulb (spa-0001).
Remove the new white bulb (spa-0004) from the kit (spa-0002).
Glass Modification (if applicable): Drill a 4mm hole in the middle of the glass cover (spa-0008) to allow venting and heat evacuation. The modified glass cover is available as reference spa-0007.
Install the modified (or unmodified) glass cover (spa-0007 or spa-0008) on the light.

closing_requirements.instruction: Verify functionality by switching the lights on if necessary.
